channel.title: LB Photo Realism
channel.description:
[IMG]http://img9.imageshack.us/img9/1376/201104022210.png[/img] [IMG]http://img193.imageshack.us/img193/8899/titleeb.png[/img]
I would rather have the original Minecraft textures, but this is fun to mess with. Anyway, I came across this when I was browsing the Minecraft wiki. It's just a texture pack that is made to look as 'real' as possible. It comes in 64x, 128x, and 256x. Most computers cannot handle the 256x. I have tried it, and it always crashes Minecraft, and I have a fairly good desktop. I have only gotten the 256x to work once, but the lag was so large there was no point in playing. Anyway, I don't recommend getting the 256x. :P
Link: http://www.minecraftforum.net/topic/127377-64x-128x-256x166-lb-photo-realism-the-great-compression-new-update-610/
All 3 (64x, 128x, and 256x) require a HD patcher. If you can't find one (because sometimes it's hard to find a direct link), tell me and I'll upload one that works with the current version of Minecraft.
Have fun.

item.title: LB Photo Realism
item.dc:creator: @ratbagmasta ratbagmasta
item.description:
@ratbagmasta wrote:

Amazing pack. Even though it crashed when i tried out the 64x version. The 512x looks like another game ._.

Read full topic

item.title: LB Photo Realism
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:5, topic:399301”][quote author=Frell link=topic=496438.msg3629345#msg3629345 date=1308084720]
When will people realize that photorealistic does not mean real pictures turned into textures…
[/quote]When they all become graphics masters[/quote]
Everyone like my new badge? Frell is jelly, I know.

Anyway, it does look a little too real. It takes away the fun of Minecraft, but this is still cool.
